item.description:
This looks interesting...........a lecture with David Dunlop

The Culture, Science and Art of Color
With David Dunlop
12.00 non members/10.00 members
You may know of this Artist through the PBS Series - "Landscapes Through Time with David Dunlop -
2009 Emmy Award Winning PBS Series.

Course Code: DDLECTSUN430PM102410
What do colors mean in paintings, in other cultures, in history? How do we perceive color? How do we use it, mix it, find it, and make it? What are its effects on romance, on lighting your living room or kitchen, or suggesting time of day or direction or mood in a painting, on a garment, or on a wall? What were the color theories of the Romans, the Persians, the Ancient Chinese, the Impressionists, the Renaissance, the Modernists, and todayâ€™s contemporary designers

All lectures are held in the School of Art, Sara Victoria Hall Auditorium.

http://daviddunlop.co...
item.how_to_find_us: meet in the auditorium, will wear the bw scarf with piano keys
item.name: The Culture, Science and Art of Color
